snippet: The 12-12 tie vote on Thursday leaves the current law intact and New Hampshire as the lone state in New England that allows the execution of anyone convicted of a capital crime.
abstract: New Hampshire Senate, in 12-12 tie vote, deadlocks on whether to repeal death penalty; vote leaves current law intact and New Hampshire as lone state in New England that allows execution of anyone convicted of capital crime.
lead_paragraph: The 12-12 tie vote on Thursday leaves the current law intact and New Hampshire as the lone state in New England that allows the execution of anyone convicted of a capital crime.

headline.main: Measure to Repeal Death Penalty Fails by a Single Vote in New Hampshire Senate
headline.print_headline: Measure to Repeal Death Penalty Fails by a Single Vote in New Hampshire Senate
